intro: Siphanthera cowanii, commonly known as the Cowan's siphanthera, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Violaceae, which includes violets and related species. The plant is characterized by its distinctive violet-blue flowers and lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
